page.title: 06Farming 1: Ownership of land
page.content: All the Downland and farmland of the area is owned by Eastbourne Corporation who bought the land in 1920s. There are 3 farms in this area: Bullockdown Farm, Black Robin Farm and Cornish Farm. All these farm a mixture of arable and pasture, usually sheep. However, Bullockdown has a dairy herd. The first two are farmed by tenants of the Corporation and the last by a bailiff who farms for the Corporation. It was the intention of the Corporation when it acquired the land to preserve its natural plant and animal life for the public. It was the Second World War that led to the increased use of the land for arable farming. This has caused many ecological changes and annoyed both conservationists and archaeologists.
